On Thu, 21 Nov 2002 DanielBook@... wrote:

> <PRE>It does happen everytime I start.  I also try to open it from windows
> everytime as well.  What I haven't tried (and will try sometime) is to reboot
> into DOS and try it from there.

Don't reboot into dos. SDL won't be able to initialize itself if you're
not in Windows. Instead, open up a dos CLI (the MS-DOS Prompt), navigate
to the neccessary directory, and launch it from there.

- Zardus
